postBySlug.html:
Overview

You can define the native event using on<event> attribute in component. The value of attribute is treated as an event handler. The event specific data will be available in event arguments.

The different event argument types for each event are,

  • Mouse Events - UIMouseEventArgs
  • Keyboard Events - UIKeyboardEventArgs

List of Native events supported

We have provided the following native event support to the In-place Editor component:

List of Native events
onmousedown onmouseup onmouseover onmousemove
onmouseout onkeydown onkeypress onkeyup

How to bind onmousedown event to In-place Editor

The onmousedown attribute is used to bind the mouse down event for In-place Editor. Here, we have explained about the sample code snippets of onmousedown in In-place Editor to change the mode as Inline.

Default.razor

@using Syncfusion.EJ2.RazorComponents.InPlaceEditor

<EjsInPlaceEditor ID="inplace_editor" ref="inPlaceEdit" onmousedown="@onMouseUp" Type="@InputType.Text" Value="@textValue" SubmitOnEnter="true" Model="@textModel">
</EjsInPlaceEditor>

@functions {
    EjsInPlaceEditor inPlaceEdit;
    object textValue = "Andrew";

    object textModel = new
    {
        placeholder = "Enter employee name"
    };
    private void onMouseUp(UIMouseEventArgs args)
    {
        if (inPlaceEdit.Mode.ToString() == "Popup")
        {
            inPlaceEdit.Mode = RenderMode.Inline;
            inPlaceEdit.DataBind();
        }
    }
}
postBySlug.excerpt: Overview You can define the native event using on  attribute in component. The value of attribute is treated as an event handler. The event…

previous.html:
Server actions

By passing In-place Editor component value to the server, the primaryKey property value must require, otherwise action not performed for remote data.

If the URL property value is empty, data passing will handled at local and also the actionSuccess event will trigger with null as argument value.

The following arguments are passed to the server when submit actions perform.

Arguments Explanations
value For processing edited value, like DB value updating.
primaryKey For value mapping to the server, like selecting DB.
name For field mapping to the server, like DB column field mapping.

Find the following sample server codes for defining models and controller functions to configure processing data.

public class SubmitModel
    {
        public string Name { get; set; }
        public string PrimaryKey { get; set; }
        public string Value { get; set; }
    }
public IEnumerable<SubmitModel> UpdateData([FromBody]SubmitModel value)
    {
        // User can process data
        return value;
    }

  • Server actions successfully done, the actionSuccess event will be fired with returned server data.

  • If the server is not responding, the actionFailure event will be fired with data, but value not updated in the Editor.

In the following sample, the actionSuccess event will trigger once the value submitted successfully into the server. In this sample, both actionSuccess and actionFailure were configured and resulted value will be converted to chips.

@using Syncfusion.EJ2.RazorComponents
@using Syncfusion.EJ2.RazorComponents.InPlaceEditor

<div class="control-section inplace-control-section">
    <div id='container'>
        <table class="table-section">
            <tr>
                <td class="sample-td"> Enter your name: </td>
                <td class="sample-td">
                    <EjsInPlaceEditor ID="element" ref="inplaceEditorObj" Name="Skill" Url="https://ej2services.syncfusion.com/development/web-services/api/Editor/UpdateData" ActionSuccess="@onActionSuccess" ActionFailure="onActionFailure" PrimaryKey="FrameWork" Adaptor="@AdaptorType.UrlAdaptor" Mode="@RenderMode.Inline" EnableEditMode="true" Type="@InputType.MultiSelect" Value="@multiSelectValue" SubmitOnEnter="true" Model="@multiSelectModel">
                    </EjsInPlaceEditor>
                </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
    </div>
</div>

<style>
    .table-section {
        margin: 0 auto;
    }
    tr td:first-child {
        text-align: right;
        padding-right: 20px;
    }
    .sample-td {
        padding-top: 10px;
        min-width: 230px;
        height: 100px;
    }
</style>

@functions {
    EjsInPlaceEditor inplaceEditorObj;

    object multiSelectValue = new string[] { "JavaScript", "jQuery" };

    object multiSelectModel = new
    {
        placeholder = "Select skill",
        mode = "Box",
        dataSource = new string[] { "Android", "JavaScript", "jQuery", "TypeScript", "Angular", "React", "Vue", "Ionic" }
    };

    private void onActionSuccess(ActionEventArgs args)
    {
        args.Value = chipCreation(args.Value.Split(','), true);
    }

    private void onActionFailure(ActionEventArgs args)
    {
        args.Value = chipCreation(args.Value.Split(','), false);
    }

    public void chipCreation(string[] data, Boolean isSuccess)
    {
        string value = "<div class='e-chip-list' />";
    }
}

The output will be as follows.

fields.seoContent: Server Actions in ASP.NET Core Blazor [Preview] In-place Editor | Syncfusion Documentation

next.html:
Globalization

Localization

Localization library allows you to localize the default text content of the In-place Editor to different cultures using the locale property. In-place Editor following keys will be localize based on culture.

Locale key en-US (default)
save Close
cancel Cancel
editIcon Click to edit
editAreaClick Click to edit
editAreaDoubleClick Double click to edit 
"fr-BE": {
    "inplace-editor": {
        "save": "enregistrer",
        "cancel": "Annuler",
        "editIcon": "Cliquez pour éditer",
        "editAreaClick": "Cliquez pour éditer",
        "editAreaDoubleClick": "Double-cliquez pour éditer"
    }
}

To load translation object in an application use load function of L10n class. In the following sample, French culture is set to In-place Editor and change the tooltip text.

@using Syncfusion.EJ2.RazorComponents
@using Syncfusion.EJ2.RazorComponents.InPlaceEditor
@using Syncfusion.EJ2.RazorComponents.DropDowns
@using Microsoft.JSInterop;

<div class="control-section inplace-control-section default_layout">
    <table class="table-section">
        <tr>
            <td> EditableOn: </td>
            <td>
                <EjsDropDownList ID="dropdownlist" ref="dropdownObj" Value="@dropdownValue" Width="auto" Change="@onchange" Placeholder="Select edit type" DataSource="@editableOnData" />
            </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="sample-td">Enter your name: </td>
            <td class="sample-td">
                <EjsInPlaceEditor ID="inplace_editor" ref="inplaceEditorObj" Mode="@RenderMode.Inline" Type="@InputType.Text" Value="@textValue" SubmitOnEnter="true" Locale="fr-BE" Model="@textModel">
                </EjsInPlaceEditor>
            </td>
        </tr>
    </table>
</div>

<style>
    .table-section {
        margin: 0 auto;
    }

    tr td:first-child {
        text-align: right;
        padding-right: 20px;
    }

    .sample-td {
        padding-top: 10px;
        min-width: 230px;
        height: 100px;
    }
</style>

@functions {
    EjsInPlaceEditor inplaceEditorObj;
    EjsDropDownList dropdownObj;
    [Inject]
    protected IJSRuntime JsRuntime { get; set; }

    object textValue = "Andrew";
    object dropdownValue = "Click";
    public string[] editableOnData = { "Click", "DblClick", "EditIconClick" };

    object textModel = new
    {
        placeholder = "Enter some text"
    };

    private void onChange(ChangeEventArgs args)
    {
        var editType = args.ItemData.Value;
        this.inplaceEditorObj.EditableOn = editType;
        this.inplaceEditorObj.DataBind();
    }

    protected override void OnAfterRender() {
        //Refer the path for the locale data
        this.JsRuntime.Ejs().LoadLocaleData("wwroot/js/locale.json");
    }
}

Right to left

Specifies the direction of the In-place Editor component using the enableRtl property. For writing systems that require it like Arabic, Hebrew, etc., the direction can be switched to right-to-left.

It will not change based on the locale property.

@using Syncfusion.EJ2.RazorComponents
@using Syncfusion.EJ2.RazorComponents.InPlaceEditor

<div class="control-section inplace-control-section default_layout">
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="col-lg-6 col-md-6 col-sm-6 col-xs-6 control-title content-title"> Enter your name: </td>
            <td class="col-lg-6 col-md-6 col-sm-6 col-xs-6">
                <EjsInPlaceEditor id="inplace_editor" ref="inplaceEditorObj" EnableRtl="true" mode="@RenderMode.Inline" type="@InputType.Text" value="@textValue" submitOnEnter="true">
                </EjsInPlaceEditor>
            </td>
        </tr>
    </table>
</div>

<style>
    #container {
        display: flex;
        justify-content: center;
        align-items: center;
        height: 80px;
    }
    #element {
        width: 150px;
    }
    .content-title {
        font-weight: 500;
        margin-right: 20px;
        display: flex;
        align-items: center;
    }
</style>

@functions {
    object textValue = "Andrew";

    object textModel = new
    {
        placeholder = "Enter some text"
    };
}

The output will be as follows.

Format

Formatting is a way of representing the value in different format. You can format the following mentioned components with its format property, when it passed through the In-place Editor model property.

  • DatePicker
  • DateRangePicker
  • DateTimePicker
  • NumericTextBox
  • Slider
  • TimePicker
@using Syncfusion.EJ2.RazorComponents
@using Syncfusion.EJ2.RazorComponents.InPlaceEditor

<div class="control-section inplace-control-section default_layout">
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="col-lg-6 col-md-6 col-sm-6 col-xs-6 control-title"> DatePicker </td>
            <td class="col-lg-6 col-md-6 col-sm-6 col-xs-6">
                <EjsInPlaceEditor id="datepicker" mode="@RenderMode.Inline" type="@InputType.Date" value="@dateValue" model="@dateModel">
                </EjsInPlaceEditor>
            </td>
        </tr>
    </table>
</div>

<style>
    #container {
        display: flex;
        justify-content: center;
    }
    .content-title {
        font-weight: 500;
        margin-right: 20px;
        display: flex;
        align-items: center;
    }
</style>

@functions {
    public DateTime dateValue { get; set; } = new DateTime(DateTime.Now.Year, DateTime.Now.Month, DateTime.Now.Day);

    object dateModel = new
    {
        placeholder = "Select date",
        format = "yyyy-MM-dd"
    };
}

The output will be as follows.
